standardPublicSources.description: If this element is specified and set to 'true', indicates that ISDA defined Standard Public Sources are applicable.

publicSource.description: A public information source, e.g. a particular newspaper or electronic news service, that may publish relevant information used in the determination of whether or not a credit event has occurred. ISDA 2003 Term: Public Source.

specifiedNumber.description: The minimum number of the specified public information sources that must publish information that reasonably confirms that a credit event has occurred. The market convention is two. ISDA 2003 Term: Specified Number.
